Utils¶

class utils.pdb_formatix.RosettaUtils.RosettaPDBFile(pdb_string=None, pdb_path=None, pdb_handle=None, verbose=False)[source]¶

Class for preparing PDB files for ROSETTA/FARNA

make_rna_non_rosetta()[source]¶

Reverses changes required for ROSETTA, especially X -> rX.

Arguments:
  • pdb_string = contents of PDB file as a string
Output:
  • new PDB returned as a string
make_rna_rosetta_ready()[source]¶

ROSETTA has some special requirements for PDB files.

Arguments:
  • pdb_string = contents of PDB file as a string
Output:
  • new PDB returned as a string
class utils.pdb_formatix.PDBFile.PDBFile(pdb_string=None, pdb_path=None, pdb_handle=None, verbose=False)[source]¶

Class for holding data from a PDB file and modifying it.

check_and_get_first_model()[source]¶

Check if there are more than one models and get only the first one

count_models()[source]¶

Count models in the PDB file

Output:
  • number of models as an int
detect_proteins()[source]¶

Check if there are any aminoacid fragments in the file

Output:
  • True if there are some, False otherwise
get_fasta(name='seq', lowercase=False)[source]¶

Format sequence in FASTA format, with a header and lines split at 80 characters.

Arguments:
  • name = name of the sequence (it’s put in the header line)
Output:
  • FASTA returned as a string
get_model(model_num)[source]¶

Get n-th model from the file

Arguments:
  • model_num = number of model to get, starts with 0
pedantic_pdb()[source]¶

Do everything that’s possible to fix PDB: 3-to-1, no HETATMs, TERs etc.

remove_non_atoms()[source]¶

Remove all lines that are not ATOMs

remove_short_chains(threshold=9)[source]¶

Remove chains that have chains with a small number of atoms.

Arguments:
  • threshold = if chain has more atoms, it stays in the result
resname_check_and_3to1()[source]¶

Check if resnames are 3 letter long and if so convert them to 1 letter.

save(file_path)[source]¶

Save current PDB to disk

Arguments:
  • file_path = path where it will be saved
seq_from_amber_like_pdb()[source]¶

Extract sequence from a PDB and return it as a string - use it for amber-like files.

Output:
  • sequence, returned as a string, such as: RG5 RC RU RG RG RG RC RG RC RA RG RG3 RC5 RC RU RG RA RC RG RG RU RA RC RA RG RC3
seq_from_pdb()[source]¶

Extract sequence from a PDB and return it as a string.

Output:
  • sequence, returned as a string
set_residues_bfactor(bfactors)[source]¶

Set B-factor to any value you want

Arguments:
  • bfactors = list of B-factors that will be set, should be of same length as nucleotide sequence
set_string(pdb_string)[source]¶

Change PDB string stored in this instance of the class

Arguments:
  • pdb_string = new PDB string
terminate_chains()[source]¶

Add ‘TER’ at the end of chain if none ‘TER’s are found in PDB.

validate_pdb()[source]¶

Check if file is a PDB structure

Output:
  • True if it is a PDB, False otherwise

Module for rebuilding all atom representation from reduced, 3 atom representation.

utils.pdb_formatix.rebuilder.check_3_atom(pdb_string)[source]¶

Check what number of atoms per residue in PDB

Arguments:
  • pdb_string = string with PDB structure to check
Output:
  • True if there are 3 atoms per residue, False otherwise
utils.pdb_formatix.rebuilder.check_and_rebuild(input_pdb, output_pdb)[source]¶

Check PDB representation and rebuild if necessary

Arguments:
  • input_pdb = path to input PDB
  • output_pdb = path to output PDB
Output:
  • True if rebuilding was necessary, False if not
